;Recently, the world situation has become increasingly turbulent, and conflicts between civilizations and regional conflicts among various ethnic groups have become increasingly intensified. Back to troubled times. Amid many conflicts and turbulence, Turkey's series of actions in recent years have become increasingly eye-catching. President Erdogan has earned himself the nickname "Esultan" with a series of dazzling combination punches.

;

;In the Syrian civil war in the past few years, it sent troops to northern Syria to support pro-Turkey armed factions and occupied and controlled part of the Syrian territory. In the process of fighting for the sphere of influence, Erdogan was bold and ruthless. He not only dared to take action against the Assad government forces, but also dared to shoot down Russian fighter jets and helicopters supporting the Syrian army.

;

;In the 2020 "Azerbaijan-Azerbaijan War", Turkey supported Azerbaijan, severely damaged Armenia, and once again hit Russia's prestige in the Middle East. As a result, Turkey's status in the Middle East has been greatly improved, and many Arab people regard Erdogan as a national hero.

;

;Erdogan dares to challenge Putin mainly because of his membership in NATO. He knows that under the protection of this political and military bloc, Russia will not directly attack Turkey for secondary and smaller overseas interests. It is a good way to use the power of the West to enhance one's prestige among the Islamic community.

;

;After the Russia-Ukraine conflict broke out in 2022, Turkey shuttled back and forth between several parties and experienced ups and downs: On the one hand, its participation led to the negotiation of the "Black Sea Food Channel" and improved its status among NATO member states. status. On the other hand, it used its veto power in NATO to delay Finland and Sweden's applications to join NATO. This has further improved his status in the Middle East. In the eyes of the people, Erdogan is a contemporary hero who dares to say no to Russia as well as the United States and Europe. He is simply the reincarnation of Saladin.

;

;This has given Turkey a lot of points in its competition with Saudi Arabia and Iran to become the leader in the Middle East. Originally, due to the collapse of the Ottoman Empire, the fact that the Turks belong to the Turkic ethnic group rather than the Arab ethnic group, the pro-Western line implemented by Kemalism in the past few decades, and many other factors, Turkey was once marginalized in the Middle East world. Now it has finally been "Egyptian" Sudan” regained many scores.

;

;In 2023, Turkey will make another move in the Transcaucasus: supporting Azerbaijan and forcing Armenia to withdraw from the "Naka ​​region." This not only enabled Turkey and Azerbaijan to win the geopolitical dispute, but also caused Armenia to break away from Russia, its old master that it had relied on for hundreds of years, out of consideration for its own survival. This move caused Russia to lose serious points in the geopolitical conflict in the Transcaucasus.

;

;After embarrassing Finland and Sweden for nearly a year and achieving its own political goals (Finland and Sweden agreed to weaken their support for the anti-Turkey Kurdish forces), Turkey approved Finland and Sweden’s applications to join NATO, and then Increased its influence in NATO and improved relations with the United States.

;

;In October 2023, as the "Hazra-Israeli conflict" broke out in the Gaza Strip, Erdogan stood up to criticize Israel and criticized the United States and Europe, once again winning widespread support for him in the Middle East. Did he really want to revive the Ottoman Turkish Empire? How did he win so many times in a row over several years? This starts with Turkey’s political interests, cultural positioning, and geostrategy.

;

;Turkey’s national defense security depends on NATO, dominated by the United States, and its economic foundation mainly relies on the European market, dominated by the EU. In the modern world, it is simply impossible to allow Turkey to use force to retake the homeland of the former Ottoman Empire. Therefore, the main body of the secular and pro-Western concepts of "Kemalism" has not changed. Erdogan has worked hard for many years and always hopes to join the EU. When asked by the media whether he would go to the West or the East, he firmly answered: Go west and join the EU.

;

;Turkey is also a country that has great conflicts with the West culturally. As a politician, Erdogan must decide his policies based on real social foundations.

;

;In the early decades of the practice of "Kemalism", Turkey adopted a one-sided strategy towards the West. But in the past decade or so, as the power of the Islamic world has increased, the Ankara authorities certainly cannot give up this huge resource. Therefore, they must strive for leadership in the Islamic world.

;

;At the geostrategic level, Turkey has a unique advantage: as the strategic pillar of NATO in the southeast, it not only blocks the entrance and exit of the Black Sea, but also affects the security situation along the Black Sea coast and the Caspian Sea. The Transcaucasus and Central Asia have always been Russia's strategic soft belly, and Turkey has a profound influence on these two regions, whether in terms of geography, ethnicity, religion, culture, economy, etc. Turkey, which sits on the Anatolian Plateau, borders southeastern Europe to the west, Iran to the east, and the two river basins of Mesopotamia to the south. It plays a very important role.

;

;Today, Erdogan has made comprehensive use of political, religious, cultural, economic, military, geographical and other factors to combine vertical and horizontal movements and maneuvers, and has achieved many successes and expanded Turkey. geopolitical interests.

;

;But behind this set of seemingly prosperous actions, Turkey has serious problems: their economic size cannot support the talents and strategies of "Egyptian Sudan". Its inflation is very serious. On October 26, the Central Bank of Turkey announced that it would raise the benchmark interest rate by 500 basis points from 30% to 35%. This is the fifth consecutive interest rate increase since the Central Bank entered the interest rate increase cycle in June. Since 2022, Turkey's inflation rate has been running at a high level, reaching 85.51% in October 2022, and 47.83%, 58.94%, and 61.53% in the three months of July, August, and September 2023, respectively, and there is still an upward trend.

;

;Obviously, "Egypt-Sudan", as a medium-sized country in Turkey, has done too many political achievements at a loss and made a profit, and all the costs have to be borne by the people.

;

;In history, many countries have adopted strategies of inciting nationalism, playing tricks at the top, and overdrafting national power. They have achieved jaw-dropping achievements in a relatively short period of time, but the results have mostly been tragic. The reason is simple: just like a person who is not in good health and has to exhaust his energy to run a marathon, triathlon, or decathlon, of course there will be no good results.

;

;Currently, Erdogan is trying his best to control the pace of the game. After achieving his goals, he may compromise with the United States and Europe. For example: when Finland and Sweden were finally approved to join NATO, he chose to keep a low profile when the US military shot down a Turkish drone (in order to safeguard its interests with the Kurdish community).

;

;After all, in terms of national defense, Turkey relies on the United States; in terms of economy, with such a high inflation rate, it depends even more on the help of the European Union, and it has a large number of immigrants and workers in Europe, which has a great impact on Ankara. The economy is very important, and it is also Turkey’s long-term means of ethnic penetration, colonization, and cultural expansion into Europe. Therefore, whether it is a show, a show, or a dispute or conflict, it must be stopped in moderation and not completely fall out with the West.

;

;So, Erdogan is playing a medium-scale geostrategic game with Turkey's national power and influence. His intention is to use his territory spanning Europe and Asia, and his political and cultural involvement in the two camps of Europe and Islam, to jump on several ships to expand Turkey's influence in modern Europe and the Islamic world.

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 22:25:03 +0800 花十几万去南极旅游，是花钱买罪受？http://www.infzm.com/contents/259372
;;2023-11-02 21:00:00;
;

;Recently, "The ticket price for an expedition to Antarctica has been reduced by 90,000 "The post sparked heated discussions on social media.

;

;You know, every November is when the Antarctic tourism season starts. Many domestic travel agencies have started selling Antarctic tour projects. The price of a trip is basically more than 100,000 yuan, and some high-end routes can be as high as 300,000 to 400,000 yuan.

;

;For a long time, the Antarctic trip has been a niche high-end project. Many people don’t know about it. This is the first time for many people to hear that it is okay. Travel to Antarctica. Is traveling to Antarctica difficult and expensive? Is traveling to Antarctica a matter of spending money to enjoy the unique beauty, or is it "spending money to buy suffering"? Will many people traveling to Antarctica damage the ecological environment of Antarctica?

;

;;

;

;;（IC photo/图）;

;

;;Is it difficult to travel to Antarctica;

;

;Antarctica is the southernmost point of the earth. It is the last one to be discovered on the earth and the only one without humans. A continent where people live and settle.

;

;For a long time in the past, Antarctica was a mysterious place in the world until Antarctica was discovered in 1820. Since then, Antarctica has also been mainly used as a scientific research base. In December 1911, the Norwegian Amundsen expedition reached the Antarctic Pole for the first time. In 1985, my country established a scientific research station in Antarctica for the first time.

;

;In fact, Antarctica is also a tourist destination. In the 1950s, the world's first international tourist group of 500 people went to Antarctica, and Antarctic tourism officially appeared. 2007 was the first year for China to launch Antarctic tourism, and China’s first officially recognized Antarctic tour line was completed.

;

;According to statistics from the International Association of Antarctic Tourism Operators (IAATO), China is the second largest source of tourists to Antarctica. In the 2017-2018 Antarctic tourism season, a total of 51,707 tourists from around the world visited Antarctica, and the number of Chinese tourists reached 8,273, accounting for 16%, second only to the United States. A total of 1,464 Chinese people went to Antarctica in the 2022-23 Antarctic season. It is expected that in the 2023-24 Antarctic tourism season, Chinese tourists will return to 80% of the pre-epidemic number.

;

;Antarctica does not have four seasons, only two seasons, namely the warm season (November-March) and the cold season (April-October). The warm season is also the tourist season in Antarctica, because it is almost daytime and the temperature is higher, making it more suitable for tourism.

;

;Theoretically, as long as it is the Antarctic tourist season, everyone can travel to Antarctica, because traveling to Antarctica does not require a visa, and Antarctica does not belong to any nation.

;

;From a practical point of view, traveling to Antarctica is difficult. After all, our country does not have direct commercial flights to Antarctica. Tourists must first go to a country relatively close to Antarctica. , such as Argentina, Australia or New Zealand, and then go to Antarctica via cruise ships or flights from these transit countries. Therefore, if you want to apply for a transit country visa when going to Antarctica, you also need the help and services of a professional travel company.

;

;;

;

;;（IC photo/图）;

;

;;Appreciate beauty, or buy into suffering? ;

;

;As you can imagine, Antarctica has breathtaking beauty. 98% of the Antarctic continent is covered with ice and snow all year round, making people feel like they are in a pure white world, which is extremely clear and translucent from the eyes to the soul.

;

;Here, tourists will tremble at the miraculous workmanship of nature. They can enjoy the natural landscape of eternal daylight and interact with the masters of Antarctica - penguins, Blue whales, sea lions and various seagulls coexist harmoniously and happily...

;

;Antarctic tours can provide us with exclusive experiences that cannot be experienced anywhere else in the world. In order to enrich the fun of the journey, travel companies will also carry out outdoor activities such as hiking, kayaking and camping in Antarctica.

;

;Going to Antarctica to appreciate the beauty behind it also requires paying a high cost.

;

;Behind the long journey is the sound of money disappearing. Nowadays, the mainstream Antarctic tourism projects in China are to fly from China to Argentina first, and then take a cruise to Antarctica via Argentina. The departure point of most cruise ships is Ushuaia, the southernmost tip of Argentina.

;

;The flight from China to Buenos Aires, Argentina takes about 40 hours (and you have to endure the troublesome transfer). It takes a long time to take a cruise from the Argentine port to sea. It takes between 2 and 5 days of sailing time to reach the Antarctic continent. Tourists can choose to spend only a few days in the Antarctic continent; they can also choose "Antarctic Peninsula + Antarctic Circle", which will sail southward through the Antarctic Circle based on the Antarctic Peninsula.

;

;A trip to Antarctica can take about ten days if it is short, or twenty or thirty days if it is long. Depending on the aircraft cabin, cruise class and accommodation environment, the price also varies greatly. For example, the prices of various cruise companies are basically 60,000-200,000 yuan per person. Therefore, the total cost of a trip to Antarctica ranges from 70,000 to 80,000 yuan for a cheap trip to 30,000 to 400,000 yuan for an expensive trip, or even higher.

;

;The challenge of traveling to Antarctica is not only the high price, but also the "suffering" during the journey.

;

;Cruise ships arriving at the Antarctic continent basically have to pass through the Drake Strait. This is the widest strait in the world and the deepest strait in the world. Due to the influence of polar cyclones, there are strong winds and huge waves all year round. The wind force is basically above level 8 all year round. When a cruise ship passes through it, the hull will inevitably shake violently, and the probability of seasickness and vomiting among tourists is extremely high, so much so that there is a saying, "If you haven't fainted once in the Drake Passage, don't say you have been to Antarctica."

;

;Tourists who travel to Antarctica often have polarizing opinions about this journey. Some people think that the trip is worthwhile and it is a unique experience in life. Some people frankly say that spending money to buy the experience makes Antarctic travel "so cold, so far, so expensive, and so boring."

;

;;Will tourism harm Antarctica;

;

;Antarctica is recognized by the world It is a nature reserve shared by all mankind, and the protection of Antarctica has long been established in the form of international conventions. On December 1, 1959, the Antarctic Treaty was signed and came into effect on June 23, 1961.

;

;The "Antarctic Convention" aims to restrict the activities of various countries in Antarctica, the only continent on earth without a permanent population, and ensure that countries respect Antarctica.

;

;In 1991, the Special Meeting of the Antarctic Treaty Consultative Countries adopted the "Antarctic Treaty Protocol on Environmental Protection" with a view to environmental protection in Antarctica. As one of the negotiating countries, China signed the protocol. The protocol sets out strict protection measures to protect the ecological environment of the Antarctic continent and nearby areas from damage. Later, the International Association of Antarctic Tourism Operators also issued the "Activity Guide for Antarctic Tourism Practitioners" and the "Activity Guide for Antarctic Tourists".

;

;Under the constraints of these treaties, travel to Antarctica must abide by some principles. For example, large ships cannot stay in a certain place for more than 5 hours; each trip to the island Only 100 people can log in; you cannot take the initiative to get within 5 meters of the penguins; you must clean your shoes after disembarking from the boat and returning to the boat to avoid biological invasion, etc.

;

;However, climate disasters have already had a serious impact on Antarctic ecology. As the Earth heats up, Antarctic glaciers are melting and becoming more fragile. Research shows that from 1997 to 2021, more than 40% of Antarctic ice shelves have shrunk significantly.

;

;Nowadays, frequent human travel activities may make the Antarctic snow melt faster.

;

;Last year, a paper published in Nature Communications pointed out that black carbon pollution at tourist arrival points in Antarctica may increase these area of ​​snowmelt. The burning of fossil and biomass fuels creates black carbon, which absorbs light and heats the atmosphere. If black carbon falls on snow, it melts faster. As a result, environmentalists loudly shouted: Please reduce unnecessary Antarctic travel and protect the natural ecology.

;

;Embarrassingly, many domestic companies that launch Antarctic tour projects promote one of the reasons for Antarctic tours is that "some Antarctic glaciers are melting at an accelerating rate and are losing their The original natural beauty. The earlier you go, the less likely you will be able to see the most primitive Antarctic continent and retain the beauty and primitiveness that is about to disappear!" However, the arrival of more and more tourists is exacerbating the melting of Antarctic ice and snow and destroying the beauty of Antarctica. .

;

;This does not mean that all Antarctic tours should be cancelled. Man and nature can coexist harmoniously. However, it is indeed necessary to speed up the use of clean energy in Antarctic tourism, limit the number of tourists, strengthen the supervision of Antarctic tourism, and strengthen the implementation of the Antarctic Treaty, so as to minimize the negative impact of human activities in Antarctica on the Antarctic ecology.

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 21:25:04 +0800 威马破产重整，车主面临“售后难”：购置电车须评估六大风险http://www.infzm.com/contents/259689
;;2023-11-02 20:00:00;
;

;According to the National Enterprise Bankruptcy and Reorganization Case Information Network, WM Motor Technology Group Co., Ltd. has applied for bankruptcy and reorganization WM Motor's official Weibo issued a notification letter in response, saying that the company still has salvage value and hopes to actively save itself by adjusting corporate strategies, solving financial debt problems, and getting investors to participate in restructuring and development. However, according to feedback from many WM owners, in early 2023, WM supporting software frequently experienced failures such as "unable to connect, network abnormality" and so on. In response to this, WM Motor publicly responded: "Currently, WM Motor's engine system has returned to normal, and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused to everyone!"

;

;Judging from the current situation, if we cannot wait for the "White Horse Rider" "Once WM Motor goes bankrupt, more than 100,000 car owners will face a "complete shutdown" of their vehicle systems.

;

;The main components of electric vehicles have changed from the engine and gearbox of previous fuel vehicles to three-electric systems. In the electric vehicle maintenance market, new energy vehicle-related product technologies and parts supply are all mastered In the hands of OEMs and EMC manufacturers, independent repairers rarely participate. This means that when electric vehicle companies such as WM Motor are eliminated due to factors such as fierce market competition, the after-sales service chain will be broken, and car owners will not be able to find corresponding substitutes in the market.

;

;The experience of a Weimar owner is a typical example. The power battery of the WM EX5 car he purchased malfunctioned. When it was charged to 80%, it would automatically jump to 100%. When the remaining 20% ​​of power was used, the car would stop moving. Because it was still within the manufacturer's warranty period, the car owner drove the car to the Kuangshan store of Jinan Weima User Center for repair. It still has not been repaired in nearly half a year because the manufacturer did not provide spare parts. The car owner contacted the 4S store again, and the 4S store said that it could no longer operate and asked him to tow the car away and solve the problem himself. The car owner also complained to the manufacturer many times, but it has not been resolved.

;

;Weima owners are facing "after-sales difficulties", which reveals that electric cars are not as beautiful as the owners imagined. Due to strong policy support, China's electric vehicle industry has developed rapidly. The latest statistics released by the Ministry of Public Security show that the number of electric vehicles in China currently exceeds 18 million. However, with the rapid development of electric vehicles, there are still six major risks. In addition to the difficulties encountered by Weimar owners mentioned above, they also involve aspects such as cruising range, charging, vehicle safety, data and privacy, and assisted driving. When buying a car, car owners must not Not aware.

;

;Some electric vehicle manufacturers deliberately exaggerate the cruising range of their vehicles in order to promote sales. According to a report by China Times in March this year, most new energy vehicle 4S stores marked the NEDC comprehensive working condition (driving cycle test) cruising range and did not mark the actual cruising range. Mr. Liu, an online ride-hailing driver, told a reporter from China Times that an electric car he mentioned in May 2022 had a range of 505 kilometers, but in actual driving, whether it was driving on the highway or in the city, , the cruising range can only reach about 300 kilometers, and in winter it only has more than 200 kilometers, and once it even "slumped down" on the highway.

;

;The cruising range is not worthy of its name, and electric vehicles charge slowly, often taking six to eight hours to fully charge. This greatly affects the consumer experience. Especially when there is an urgent need for a car, long charging time will make consumers feel very inconvenient.

;

;In this regard, electric vehicle companies have provided two options. One is the DC fast charging mode, which takes 1 to 1.5 hours. However, frequent use of fast charging mode will affect battery life. Therefore, current electric vehicles still mainly rely on AC slow charging.

;

;Secondly, some car companies provide battery swapping models, but the costs for car owners are high. At the same time, the investment cost of battery swapping stations is high and the number of built ones is limited.

;

;The safety of electric vehicles is another major pain point that consumers are concerned about. In recent years, there have been many accidents involving spontaneous combustion of electric vehicles, posing a serious threat to the life and property safety of car owners. Statistics from the emergency management department show that in the first quarter of 2023 alone, the spontaneous combustion rate of electric vehicles increased by 32%, with an average of 8 electric vehicles catching fire (including spontaneous combustion) every day.

;

;One of the directions for the intelligentization of electric vehicles is digitization. Electric vehicles can not only collect the owner’s face data through the in-car camera, but may also collect information such as the owner’s place of residence, whereabouts, and consumption places. , once such data is leaked by car companies or stolen by hackers, it will cause more serious consequences. According to a notice issued by the Maine Attorney General's Office in August this year, Tesla's data breach in May affected more than 75,000 people, including records related to employees. The incident originated from "internal Employee misconduct”.

;

;The application of assisted driving technology in electric vehicles will bring more problems. Some car companies refer to assisted driving technology as "assisted autonomous driving" or "autonomous assisted driving". Sales staff will hype it up when promoting, beautifying it as "autonomous driving". If there is an accident, it will become "assisted driving". . The assisted driving technology used by many electric vehicles currently has a paradox in itself. It not only advocates liberating the driver, but also requires the driver to supervise and be ready to take over anytime and anywhere. If an accident occurs, how to divide the responsibilities between the driver and the car company?

;

;Some of the six major risks associated with electric vehicles may be improved with technological advancement, while others may remain unresolved for a long time. Therefore, when people buy electric vehicles, they must not be concerned about the risks promoted by car companies. "Environmental protection" (the degree of environmental pollution caused by batteries is not low) and "intelligence" are fully accepted, but it is still necessary to evaluate rationally and objectively before deciding whether to place an order.

;

;In order to further optimize the business environment, the State Council recently issued the "Decision on Cancellation and Adjustment of a Group of Fines" ( (hereinafter referred to as the "Decision"), 33 fines were canceled and adjusted in the fields of industry, information technology, housing and urban-rural construction, among which 16 fines were canceled and 17 fines were adjusted. If fine matters are canceled, the relevant fine provisions in relevant administrative regulations and departmental rules will be temporarily suspended from the date of issuance of the "Decision"; if fines are adjusted, the relevant fine provisions in the revised relevant administrative regulations and departmental rules will be implemented.

;

;The 16 fines canceled by the "Decision" include 2 from the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, 2 from the Ministry of Education, 5 from the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development, 3 from the People's Bank of China, and 1 from the National Forestry and Grassland Administration. , 1 State Post Bureau, 2 National Bureau of Disease Control and Prevention; 17 fines adjusted, including 1 Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, 1 Ministry of Emergency Management, 13 National Press and Publication Administration, and 2 National Bureau of Disease Control and Prevention. These fines are mainly concentrated in areas closely related to the production and life of enterprises and the people. The purpose of cancellation and adjustment is to effectively reduce the burden on enterprises and the people.

;

;The cancellation and adjustment of fines involve a total of 7 administrative regulations and 6 departmental regulations. The "Decision" puts forward clear requirements for the legislative work after the cancellation and adjustment of fines. Relevant departments of the State Council must submit relevant administrative regulations modification plans to the State Council within 60 days from the date of issuance of the "Decision" and complete the modification and abolition of relevant departmental regulations. If departmental regulations need to be adjusted according to the revised administrative regulations, the modification and abolition must be completed within 60 days from the date of promulgation of the relevant administrative regulations. Considering that there is a 30-day period for soliciting opinions on the modification and abolition of departmental regulations, it is stipulated that if the modification or abolition of departmental regulations cannot be completed within the above period due to special reasons, it may be appropriately extended, but the extension period shall not exceed 30 days at most.

;

;The "Decision" emphasizes that after the fines are cancelled, the relevant departments must study carefully in accordance with the law, strictly implement regulatory responsibilities, focus on strengthening supervision during and after the event, improve supervision methods, standardize supervision procedures, and improve the scientific and scientific nature of supervision. Simplicity and precision further enhance regulatory efficiency and provide strong support for promoting high-quality development.

; Thu, 02 Nov 2023 19:25:03 +0800 “丑小鸭”的生长：一所学校防治青少年抑郁的探索与思考http://www.infzm.com/contents/259838
;;2023-11-02 17:58:46;

;;

;

;On October 19, 2023, girls confided and comforted each other on the playground of Ugly Duckling Middle School ;(Southern People Weekly reporter Weng Huan/picture);

;

;"Did you want to come here on your own, or were you 'tricked' by your parents?"

;

;"Half and half. When I came here, I realized, hey, it's not at all what I thought."

;

;Under the bright sun, more than a dozen buses and minibuses were parked here. The mountainside of Ruixing Village in Yiliang, Kunming. Hundreds of people filed in, lingering in the classrooms, student dormitories, book bars, and running tracks of this rural school, observing carefully, even the bathrooms painted with paint.

;

;Visitors include principals, moral education directors, classroom teachers from all over the country, officials and entrepreneurs from the local education sector, social organizations engaged in family education and private innovative education, as well as some who “can’t figure it out” in their own families. Parents worried about their children. They were curious about how a school called "Ugly Duckling Middle School" could help a group of children who seemed to be surly, tired of studying, or even suffering from deep depression to blossom into a natural and brilliant life.

;

;For these questions, the "ugly duckling" principal Zhan Danian always smiles and does not answer immediately. In the 13 years since he founded this school, various questions and controversies have continued, which he no longer thinks is strange. But he did not expect that the youth depression problem that he had deeply realized in running the school would actually trigger a strong response after launching the "First Youth Psychological Safety Forum" (jointly with the China Education Thirty Forum), and the reverberation continues to this day.

;

;The "2023 China Mental Health" Blue Book released on October 10, 2023 shows that 40% of Chinese teenagers feel lonely, the depression detection rate among high school students is 40%, and the depression detection rate among junior high school students is 40%. is 50%, and the risk of mild anxiety among college students is 38%. Peng Kaiping, dean of the Academy of Social Sciences of Tsinghua University, once wrote an article pointing out that today's Chinese teenagers have "four no's": no interest in learning, no interest in the real world, no ability to deal with the real society, and no interest in life. Therefore, the theme of this forum has been upgraded from the previously mentioned "youth mental health" to "psychological safety".

;

;;

;

;In the psychology room of Ugly Duckling Middle School, teacher Li Guihong (middle) performs sand table psychotherapy for students. Some students also sit quietly and relax here;( Southern People Weekly reporter Weng Huan/picture) ;

;

;In Zhan Danian’s view, depression is just a symptom, and behind it are the flaws in the current educational ecology. "The essence of education is to develop students' personalities, rather than using a ruler to measure students. The best and most equitable education should be education that adapts to students' personalities, so that every student's potential can be developed."

;

;We have actually heard this argument too many times. The key is how to put it into practice. Therefore, in the "wild education" of the "ugly duckling", is there really any experience that can be discovered and learned from to prevent and treat depression in teenagers? What kind of social and family symptoms are behind every depressed child? Are they definitely unsolvable? Our reporters went to Kunming and Yiliang to explore the possibility of dispelling the shadow of education under the sun.

;

;;

;

;At 11:30 in the morning, the students of Ugly Duckling Middle School were having physical education class. Students in this school have about 3 hours of outdoor exercise time every day;(Southern People Weekly reporter Weng Huan/picture);

;

;" It’s all my fault”

;

;

;During the interview, several teachers and students mentioned to me a boy named Luo Ting who was an “academic master”. "I have experience living abroad, I have a good family background, and I am handsome, but I am not showy at all." Before coming to Ugly Duckling, Luo Ting studied in an international school and a public school in Shanghai. Due to his discomfort with school teaching and the epidemic, he stayed home for a long time. In the end, I just didn’t go to school at all. He didn't leave the door every day and didn't say a word, which made his grandfather, who had watched him grow up, very worried.

;

;After arriving at the "ugly duckling" thousands of miles away, he felt that this school was "quite different", but it was not "love at first sight". In the first month or two, Luo Ting immersed himself in solving problems wherever he went, without talking to anyone.

;

;I don’t know when he started playing the Pearl River piano in the corridor, and he seemed to be a different person. "I studied for half a year when I was in the second grade of elementary school. I have been idle for four or five years. It is equivalent to starting from scratch and learning on my own." He did not seek quick results. He played "Canon" and "Dance of Flowers" according to the music scores he found. During the semester, classmates came over to listen from time to time, but he continued calmly. "That kind of joy is difficult to express in words."

;

;Later, Luo Ting became best friends with Zhihan and Jiayu, who had similar interests. They will get together to talk about Sino-US trade and the Russia-Ukraine conflict. In the second semester of the third year of junior high school, several people formed a study group and used the precious "exemption from military training" time to study by themselves and prepare for the exam. "In 'The Ugly Duckling', I also fell in love with running." Luo Ting said with a smile. "Zhihan originally weighed more than 100 kilograms. After running, he lost 40 kilograms and became a legend in the school!" Zhihan's "Inspirational Run" turned Luo Ting into a running expert. The school's track is close to a 125-meter lap. They run 40 laps every day and are almost "unbeatable."

;

;Ji Guoer is a carefree girl who is "thick on the outside but delicate on the inside". While chatting, she looked away from time to time, and finally pointed to a figure beside the basketball hoop, "Teacher Xiao Deng, I have a best friend over there, and she really wants to chat with you." So, Ji Guo and I Her best friend, He Man, walked around the playground arm in arm.

;

;Ji Guoer said that He Man liked to cry for a while, so she didn't ask so many questions and just made her laugh. "I told her that you look ugly when you cry. She said you are so annoying. Haha, this trick works." Ji Guoer laughed heartlessly.

;

;"What about the students who don't like to talk?"

;

;"We are all in the same life class and live under the same roof. Even those who don't like to talk will start talking after a long time. They have their own little secrets. If you talk to her every day, she will naturally come to you."

;

;She told me about her classmates with her fingers: Xiaoxing is generous and does not hold grudges; Jing Wen She likes reading and playing the piano; He Man is cheerful and has a good personality...

;

;"Did you just say that she loves to cry?"

;

;"Hey, as soon as she saw me crying, she put herself out again Hold back your tears and comfort me."

;

;We were happy together. But she became serious: "Actually, people of our age are saving face. We don't want to appear weak, we want to be strong. Then we have to let them (; Classmates;) slowly accept the world."

;

;Ji Guoer, who seems to be proactive, considerate to others, and able to point out other people's problems, can also be rude in the eyes of teachers and easily loses the boundaries of expression. . Xiang Guoyue said that adolescent children often show the characteristics of hedgehogs. The "ugly duckling" students' personal will may have been suppressed in their original schools and families, and this will be reflected when they get here. Li Guihong, who has joined the school since 2011, originally felt that the children were "unruly" and would always use prank-like methods to announce their presence. "School Zhan said that children should use a magnifying glass to see their strengths and reading glasses to see their weaknesses. So I also learned to appreciate them."

;

;"In 'The Ugly Duckling', if you are talkative, you will be allowed to receive new classmates. If you can play the piano, try your best to play it; if you write a good article, it will be posted. We have a C poet who wrote an article about love and an article about life. Everyone can admire him... whether it is a theatrical performance or In the speech contest, the school requires everyone to appear on the stage, and they have to go on stage to do soy sauce. I will applaud you no matter what the performance is." Ji Guoer's words poured out like beans from a bag.

;

;"Yes, there is Xiaoying." Long Jinying, a life teacher who graduated from the police academy, has just turned 20, and her long hair cannot stop her heroic spirit. During the few days of the interview, she was either cleaning up the potted plants she bought, or using a saw to cut wood strips and build flower stands. "Xiaoying is so awesome. She helps you prepare medicines when you are sick, decorate and paint walls, and dance Dai dance during the Torch Festival. She can do it all! She is very good at dealing with children who have emotional outbursts and will let you go for a walk. She will talk to you again when you calm down. ." Xiaoying in the minds of Ji Guoer and He Man seems to be the common "idol" of the girls.

;

;;

;

;Students having lunch;(Southern People Weekly reporter Weng Huan/picture);

;

;" Send them to the ugly old duck"

;

;But capable people like Xiaoying and Xiang Guoyue also have times when they are not very motivated.

;

;"Like Pu Pu and Tian Lan, although their parents have had disputes with them, they can generally calm down, accept their children's current situation, and cooperate with the school." Xiang Guoyue pointed out that the most difficult thing is The problem is that some parents send their children here because they hope that "you will educate their children in their own way, only caring about the results and not caring about what is behind them"; or they are not aware of their own problems and find it difficult to communicate; what's more, He almost doesn't care about his children.

;

;“Children lack love in their hearts, but their parents seldom respond and even hurt them again and again. As a result, parents and children hurt each other. Some children are also forced to get involved in adult relationships. , learned violence, alienation and indifference." Li Guihong said.

;

;Feeling the importance of family education, Zhan Danian opened a parent class soon after the school opened. His private account has continued to spread educational concepts at a frequency of two messages a day for many years. Many parents gain spiritual strength from Zhan Danian's official account after their children become depressed, tired of studying, and stop communicating with their parents. Some will send their children here directly. But change does not happen overnight.

;

;He Man, who has a big face and bright eyes, grew up in H City on the border between China and Vietnam. The image that impressed her most about her childhood was that her father took her to school on a motorcycle, while her mother was busy with the beauty salon business at night and sleeping during the day.

;

;When she was transferred to Q City in the fourth grade, her father had no time to take care of her, so he found her old math teacher and paid her to come across town to be a "nanny + tutor".

;

;From sixth grade to second grade, He Manwan changed schools five or six times. "I was the vice-captain of cheerleading at the time and ranked first in running. The boys in the senior class added me on WeChat and QQ, and the girls in the same grade were unhappy with me and called me green tea. The students in the second grade of junior high school threatened me to pay protection money, so I had no choice but to fight for my life. There were a lot of gangsters running towards the back door. The teacher said I wasn't good at studying and wouldn't let anyone else play with me."

;

;She smoked in the corner and was reported. "Actually, everyone smokes, but they only talk about me."

;

;She cried to her father, but it was useless. "You didn't listen to me carefully."

;

;"Where's mom?"

;

;"Mom doesn't even know where my school is or where I live in the first semester of junior high school."

;

;She had swallowed about twenty pills of ibuprofen, all of which she had saved by going to the school infirmary when she had a cold. "I can't even jump off the building. I'm surrounded by railings and have no conditions. I just take medicine. Life is really meaningless. My mother told the teacher that I was obsessed with ghosts and deliberately scared them."

;

;She escaped from school again. open. In the end, he was caught by his parents and locked up in the underground garage of his hometown in H City for a night. "Hit me with a wire, slapped me, choked me, and dragged me to wash my tattoos."

;

;She returned to Q City. I went to work in a mobile phone store and was taken back by my parents. "They just want to take me back. They have not participated in too many of my lives. I just want to escape."

;

;Speaking of which, a girl who took a few days off returned to school. , He Man looked at the gate with a hint of happiness: "Many of our classmates often bring a big bag of plum potato chips, jelly, and pizza for us to eat when they come back from vacation. Some of them will bring a cup of milk tea for everyone in the life class, which is beautiful. ."

;

;In "The Ugly Duckling", Juanjuan asked her to be the monitor; Principal Yang asked her to receive visitors; Xiaoying would comfort her and listen to her. She caught up with the summer camp not long after she came here. "We chatted on the playground from morning to night, and when it got dark, we watched movies and ate barbecue together..." She originally thought that this would be the first time she called her parents after arriving at the "Ugly Duckling". I cried, but ended up laughing the whole time. "I used to be very attached to my ex-boyfriend. Lao Li said that I actually knew nothing about love. Haha. But I really understand. The outside world is unreal. Now I have learned to see people."

;

;Because of the course She fell behind too much, so at the age of 15, she retaken the second grade of junior high school in the "ugly duckling". She was not in a hurry, and slowly began to sympathize with her father who always hated her.

;

;My grandparents’ hometown is not in Yunnan. After decades here, they are still not welcome in the town. Her father, who is over fifty, worked as an accountant in H City in his early years. In He Man's eyes, he is actually the most sensible person in the family.

;

;"He is the most serious person in the family, but when he was a child, even a piece of candy was extravagant. He hated the family and felt it was unfair. He was the one who wiped the mess. So he hoped that I would make a difference. I can stay with you."

;

;Before coming to "The Ugly Duckling", He Man went to Kunming to see a psychiatrist. "The doctor said that the gap between your two generations is too deep. Anyway, my parents don't ask me about many things, and I don't tell them either. Sometimes I am naughty and just want to deliberately anger them." She paused and softened her tone. : "My dad has diabetes, and I won't deliberately anger him anymore."

;

;In Ono's story, she and her mother are almost the only ones.

;

;"Today is the 136th day since I came to Ugly Duckling." As soon as she sat down, she clearly stated the day. Every day that passes, she will cross off a line on her calendar - "It feels like one day closer to going home."

;

;Unlike the other girls who can't wait to share, Ono's eyes and mouth are full of excitement. Take a look at it. She is good at art. Recently, she has contributed to the school's "class culture", from the stairwells to the dormitory walls to the decorative paintings in the corridors. She is good at singing and dancing. But as if that wasn't enough to satisfy her cravings.

;

;"She often hurts herself. She uses rulers, stones, gel pens to break them, and everything else. Her hands and legs are like fish scales." Li Guihong said that Pu Pu's self-mutilation is more of a This is a kind of emotional catharsis, and there is an additional intention of "seeking attention" in Ono's behavior.

;

;In Ono’s description, her mother felt that the divorce was because of her daughter, “so she always resented me with personal emotions.” From an early age, the more her mother did not allow her to do anything, the more she came to The more I want to do it. When they quarreled, the two always used vicious words to accuse each other, "She said I was delusional. I said you should go and have a look, there must be something wrong with you."

;

;Ono used to love giving to her mother Write a letter, write a WeChat, or handwrite a letter of a few hundred words, then take a photo and send it to "Lao Li". "Actually, she wants me to forward it to her mother. Some parents from other provinces may come three or four times. She thinks why her mother never comes. If she doesn't come, she doesn't love me. To realize it immediately is to love me."

;

;"When we grow up, we will send those rebellious parents to a school called 'Ugly Duck', or 'Ugly Chicken', haha!" Speaking of the suggestion when chatting with classmates , Ono shrugged and laughed.

;

;But her mother knows that she wants to buy "Lolita" clothes and loves to go to comic exhibitions, so she will fully support her. "I'm not a qualified daughter...I'm sorry for my mother." Ono's eyes were a little red. She hopes that she will be independent soon and be able to earn money. "I will give money to my mother when I go out."

;

;"My biological father? I haven't seen him. He doesn't want me because I am a girl. Does he want to see me now? No." Maybe."

;

;As for "The Ugly Duckling", she had checked this place before coming here. The name of the school was weird. "Live a happy and complete educational life..." She murmured the school motto "The Ugly Duckling", which was quoted from the educator Zhu Yongxin, "Can it be realized?"

;

;She refused to graduate from the third grade of junior high school. , hoping to leave as soon as possible, because there are a lot of fun things waiting for her outside. In her hometown, she went to KTV in the fourth and fifth grade of elementary school. “Those sisters who added WeChat are so beautiful.” They praised her that “she can sing and dance, can do makeup well, and won’t cause trouble.” Some adults also taught her “don’t care too much.” She found this life philosophy to be insightful and joyful.

;

;She hopes that Lao Li will communicate with her mother and let her go back. But her mother was worried. "In Yiliang, we can cut off social ties between her and her hometown." Li Guihong said that she once gently reminded Ono that people in society are loyal, but small favors may be used to exploit minors. "She is not yet able to listen to these principles, but we have to explain them to her bit by bit."

;

;;

;

;October 21, 2023, the first Youth Psychological Safety Forum Lecture On-site ;(Southern People Weekly reporter Weng Huan/Photo);

;

;New educational philosophy

;

;With more individuality The story of Pu Pu and Ono, I left the "ugly duckling" who stayed for three days and headed to Kunming. Regarding adolescent depression, various special discussions have long been common, but the popularity of the first Youth Psychological Safety Forum held in Kunming from October 21 to 22 exceeded the organizers’ expectations. Active speakers, from writing notes to grabbing the microphone, to some rushing directly to the side of the stage, have to speak their minds "with offense".

;

;A reader of Zhan Danian said that he had been studying well since childhood and had been attending the best local schools, but he had never been happy or had a sense of accomplishment. He was still confused when he was in his thirties; several teachers and parents brought Children were asked to seek help on-site for school bullying and mental illness problems; several teachers from different schools also suggested that they wanted to care for students, but were unable to do so. “We are also problem teachers, who will help us?!”

;

;“It not only shows that everyone has a huge desire to express themselves and their enthusiasm to solve problems, but also shows that many people, whether they are educators or parents, have psychological problems that need to be seen. Being diverted." One of the guests lamented.

;

;The "Minor Protection Law" revised and implemented in June 2021 clearly stipulates: The education administration department should strengthen the mental health education of minors and establish a mechanism for early detection and timely intervention of minors' psychological problems. .

;

;But inside and outside the forum, people discuss more about real-life problems that cause depression or are caused by depression.

;

;Famous education expert Feng Enhong pointed out that what we face in building a defensive line of psychological safety education for teenagers is the overall loss of education in today's society.

;

;Chen Yu is the founder of the family education platform "Youth is Different". He has conducted in-depth interviews with hundreds of primary and secondary school students who are depressed, tired of studying, struggling and desperate. Among the students who came to her for face-to-face and telephone consultation this year, the number that increased sharply was high school freshmen.

;

;"On the first day of their first year in high school, some children do their homework until 11 o'clock at night. The teacher said, you are already in high school, do you still expect to sleep well? There are Beijing's 'Six Little Strong' (;Haidian Famous School;) students asked me, why do I need to learn to the point of being word for word? This is a confusion of many children. "

;

;A student told Chen Yu that on the first day of school, the school mobilized like this: "If you have grades, you have everything. The classmates sitting next to you are all enemies in the high school entrance examination room." She met I heard about a girl from a prestigious school in Shenzhen who got up to study at 4 a.m. and her period gradually stopped coming. She asked the girl, "Does everything have to give way to grades? Are grades more important than body?"

;

;"The girl said, yes. 'That's good, I don't have to worry about exams hitting my menstrual period anymore' There is also a child who ranks first in grade in Liaoning who feels like he is 'like a thief who stole the emperor's crown', as if he was sitting on a high platform and would fall down if a gust of wind blew." Chen Yu concluded that children of this generation , get tired of studying earlier, take a longer break from studying, and find it more difficult to resume studying.

;

;“All the brilliant achievements of education are meaningless if a child suffers from reduced vision, lack of sleep, weak constitution, mental deformity, or even premature death!” Li Zhenxi exclaimed in his speech.

;

;When students are prone to depression or are diagnosed, they will encounter completely different situations.

;

;A child Chen Yu interviewed was ostracized by his classmates after he was diagnosed with depression, and his desk was filled with garbage and mineral water bottles. Later, the new class teacher invited her out to chat in a cafe. When school resumed, she held the little girl's hand and walked into the school. When she arrived at the door of the class, the whole class applauded to welcome her, and the child's psychology changed drastically.

;

;But in a place in Jiangsu and Zhejiang, a school conducted psychological tests and evaluations for students approaching their third year of high school. "The school said to some of the children that your current emotional state cannot adapt to the school's next studies." Expelled them from school. Many children with depression will also say that no teachers or students have contacted me since I returned home. They feel that I have been abandoned by this organization."

;

;Solution Where is the Tao?

;

;Educator Yang Dongping’s answer is that the education department continues to introduce new policies to “reduce burdens”, but how to get rid of the long-term conflict between educational policies and educational reality, and the lack of vitality in quality education? There is only one answer: China needs a new educational philosophy and a top-down design from scratch.

;

;He further proposed: We should reduce the number of teaching hours from the source, reduce the concentration of teaching and the difficulty of examinations, implement the all-subject teacher model in primary schools, and improve the educational ecology; cancel key schools, pilot subject stratification, and have It facilitates communication among students and reduces labeling or discrimination caused by the educational diversion system.

;

;“When you respect your child as a person and get along with him, you will get a normal and healthy person; if you treat your child as a learning machine, you will get an object. "Yang Dongping's powerful voice and Zhan Danian's simple language aroused strong resonance from the audience.

;

;Readers who visited Ugly Duckling Middle School and read Zhan Danian's account felt that "problem children" found themselves here and got to know life, and they could start anew. "So, can an ordinary school become an 'ugly duckling'? What would happen if normal children were educated in this way?"

;

;However, Zhan Danian has always emphasized that the ugly duckling middle school is a preventive one. Schools provide suitable education methods for children who cannot adapt to the traditional education system, rather than providing a methodology to solve their difficulties. "All the crux of education we encounter today cannot be changed by a forum. But it can provide a way of thinking: Is there something wrong with our teaching and our family education? This is what these discussions and voices can do. Zhan Danian, who seems to be "invincible" in front of others, admits that he is often at a loss when faced with children with depression and other symptoms. There was once a mixed-race girl whose parents separated. One of her toes was wrapped with a rubber band until it became necrotic. Then the "ugly duckling" came and wanted to wrap another toe. I've been here for several months and still haven't looked up, and progress is slow. "We had no choice but to dissuade this child because it was beyond our capabilities and required the intervention of medical institutions." There was a rare sense of loss and powerlessness in Zhan Danian's tone.

;

;I asked Chen Yu, if the school environment is difficult to change and some parents are "stubborn" as the guests said, what advice would she give to the children she interviewed?

;

;"I hope that the status quo of domestic vocational high schools and technical schools will change, so that ordinary people with skills can live a decent life. As long as a child has a little bit of sparkle, he will not be completely Deny yourself."

;

;A mother in Quanzhou once asked her for help: her son's IQ was slightly deficient, and she hoped that the child could keep up with the pace of his classmates' studies, but the child was already tired of studying. Chen Yu learned that the boy liked raising pets very much, "I said you follow me and imagine that on the street where you live, there is a seafood shop opened by your father, a photo studio opened by you, and a flower, bird, fish and insect shop opened by your child. Isn't it wonderful? She said, Teacher Chen, before others advised me to get a 'roll', I was very happy when I heard you say that."

;

;"In the present moment, understand children and the times. It is particularly important. Every child brings his own food, grass and map. We must provide comprehensive support for the children and do not let them look around and feel lonely." Chen Yu used an analogy. "A tutor who understands you, a trustworthy boyfriend/girlfriend, can be a fulcrum." If you are surrounded by people who have no support, I would tell them, stand up, and you will have a chance after you turn 18. Heal yourself and become your own nourisher. ”

;

;Before ending the interview with “The Ugly Duckling”, Pu Pu told me that she hoped to return to that “high-quality and strictly controlled” middle school to take the high school entrance examination because her uncle drove a taxi and was just in the first grade of junior high school. Her cousin has to do homework, take care of her two-year-old little brother, and cook for her uncle. If she grows up and has a good job, "it can make her cousin less hard-working." He Man said that in the past, she and her father We quarreled, and now we talk about it every few days, why didn't dad send a message? Ono, who has been studying Japanese by himself and passed N2, wants to be an illustrator when he grows up, "My mother supports me to study in Japan"; Ji Guoer's mother hopes that she can I went to the police academy, “but I want to be a kindergarten teacher and teach children. Principal Zhan also thinks I can do it. ”

;

;(Reference: Zhan Danian’s private account, guest speaker at the first Youth Psychological Safety Forum. The names of the students in the article are pseudonyms. Intern reporter Yang Yuxi also contributed to this article. )

;

;All the people gathered in this hall, all those who heard our message about Fu Da’s dementia You all have a good relationship because of the word "fate". This good relationship began at an award ceremony more than 20 years ago. My husband and Professor Xin Shiwen, the former dean of Shanheng College, won awards at the same time. Therefore, Dean Xin and I had a close relationship. In 2018, I won the Xin Shiwen Award again. The dean awarded him the title of Honorary Academician of Shanheng College, and he became associated with the Chinese University from then on.

;

;My relationship with Dr. Zhao Xiaying began in the early days of the COVID-19 invasion. I discussed with my friend Jin Shenghua that we wanted to do our best for society in the COVID-19 battle. Shenghua introduced Dr. Lei Zhaohui and Dr. Zhao Xiaying to us. I knew each other and we became friends. During Christmas last year, we had afternoon tea at the Peninsula Hotel and heard Dr. Zhao discussing the Alzheimer's disease project with Shenghua. I thought it was urgent, so I took the initiative to participate in it, hoping to do my best to help promote this project. This charitable act enables people with invisible and mild dementia to prevent and delay their symptoms, alleviate the pain of themselves and their families, and reduce the burden on society. Dr. Zhao introduced me to Dean Mok Zhongtang of Shanheng Academy and Ms. Huang Meiyun (Mrs. Gao Kun), chairman of the Kao Kun Charitable Foundation. We hit it off in all aspects and soon promoted the brain degeneration project, and the good relationship continued from this Go down.

;

;;

;

;Brigitte Lin and Dr. Zhao Xiaying (left), and Dean Mok Chung-tang of Shanheng College of the Chinese University of Hong Kong. ;(Photo courtesy of the author);

;

;After participating in the brain-smart care activity, I went to the hospital with neurologists Dr. Mo and Dr. Zhao After a few classes, I learned a lot of knowledge that I wouldn’t normally have access to. Do you know how much your brain weighs? Three pounds; do you know how many nerve cells there are in the brain? One hundred billion; each nerve cell is connected to thousands of other nerve cells through branches to form a communication network. The connections between these branches exceed one hundred billion points, and the entire connection forms a complex network. Did you know that one in ten people over the age of seventy has dementia? I have many friends who are in their seventies, eighties or nineties and have very bright minds. I like to get close to them. They have rich life experiences and the insights they have gained in life. Those treasures have a lot to learn from, so we must Take good care of the elderly.

;

;Let me tell you an interesting thing. Because I wanted to get close to the 90-year-old former superstar Sister Glenn, I went to watch the Beijing Opera with her. I was also curious about the ticketing of the opera. There were seven theatergoers, three of whom were 90 years old. One of the above, one of whom is ninety-nine years old, does not use crutches, does not use a wheelchair, does not have a caregiver, and walks in alone in a neat suit. Three people over ninety years old sing Peking Opera with amazing energy, and they are not even chatting. They speak freely without any scruples. I really can’t call them Mr. or Mrs. They live a free and easy life. During this time, everyone was joking and paired Sister Glenn and Jiujiu. I thought it was so cute. I raised my camera and shouted, "Kiss me! Kiss me!" Jiujiu generously kissed Sister Glenn on the face, and everyone clapped and applauded. hapiness.

;

;;

;

;As sponsor and project ambassador, Brigitte Lin at the launch ceremony of the "Brain Intelligence Care" service plan. ;(Photo courtesy of the author);

;

;I am 68 this year and will be 69 in November. My memory and reaction Better than before I was sixty. I read, write, draw, sing, participate in positive social activities, and keep exercising every day. In addition to hiking, I play table tennis almost every day and occasionally do yoga. I am curious about everything in the world. The most important thing is Cultivating the ability to love is something I rarely did before I was sixty. Now I seem to be living another person's life. Turns out all of these are great remedies for brain degeneration. If sixty returned to zero and started over, I would be only eight years old now.

;

;Having said so much, let’s get back to the subject. I would like to appeal to children over the age of sixty to actively sign up and test whether your brain is still as bright as before. If not, let us work together to fight back Alzheimer’s disease.

;

;(This article is Brigitte Lin’s speech at the launch ceremony of Hong Kong’s “Brain-Smart Care” service plan)
